entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 12:49PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASING POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT SNOW LATE THIS WEEK ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA... With cold temperatures continuing through late week under the current strong Arctic high pressure system, conditions are becoming favorable for significant heavy snowfall across portions of the central and southern Panhandle late this week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 3:27PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Potential for ice jams on the Kenai River from Kenai Keys to Soldotna... Observed and forecasted abnormally cold temperatures across the Western Kenai Peninsula through the remainder of the week will increase the potential for freezeup ice jams along the lower portion of the river from the Kenai Keys downstream to Soldotna. A

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 12:06PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: After a very cold Thursday morning another round of precipitation will move in, impacting the inland Northwest by the afternoon. This system will start out producing snow in the afternoon in central Oregon and spread across the rest of the forecast area overnight. Precipitation will change over to a wintry mix of snow sleet and freezing rain in central Oregon Thursday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 12:06PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: After a very cold Thursday morning another round of precipitation will move in, impacting the inland Northwest by the afternoon. This system will start out producing snow in the afternoon in central Oregon and spread across the rest of the forecast area overnight. Precipitation will change over to a wintry mix of snow sleet and freezing rain in central Oregon Thursday night.
